snippet: Investors have pulled back in May in recent years, but there are forces working against a repeat.
abstract: Paul J Lim Fundamentally column contends investors have pulled back in May in recent years, but says there are forces working against a repeat; points out that although oil prices are up moderately in 2012, prices for many other commodities are not; notes central banks around the world have been lowering interest rates to spark growth; cites other factors for market optimism.
lead_paragraph: Investors have pulled back in May in recent years, but there are forces working against a repeat.

headline.seo: Another May, Another Stock Market Decline? Maybe Not
headline.main: A Pullback in May? Maybe Not This Time
headline.print_headline: A Pullback in May? Maybe Not This Time
